intro: Urostachys andinus, commonly known as the Andean rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in the spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the cold, arid conditions of its native habitat. Urostachys andinus is often found in alpine and subalpine environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
